page.title: 07Medbourne, Drayton Councils.
page.content: Medbourne Parish Council consists of five village members, one of whom is Chairman plus a clerk to the council who does not have voting powers. They meet on the first Monday of the month for discussions on local issues but they may only advise the Harborough District Council or Leicestershire County Council of the views of the village - they have no real powers. Drayton and Nevill Holt are not large enough to have an elected parish council but a village council meet once or twice a year conducted by the Chairman and Secretary to perform almost the same duties. Medbourne have also appointed a tree warden who is responsible to the County Council.
